TEXT: The application was originally submitted by CARDINAL applicants of which PERSON was DATE ( later ; the applicant ) . The other applicants’ complaints were declared inadmissible by ORG DATE . The present applicant was born in DATE in GPE of parents who were born in the former GPE and were citizens of that country . The applicant and his parents are currently resident at FAC in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
A.

The applicant ’s parents and his brother , who was born in DATE in the former GPE , arrived in GPE from the then GPE on DATE , holding tourist visas valid from DATE . On the last - mentioned day they requested asylum in GPE , referring to the attempted coup d’etat in GPE . On DATE ORG ( sisäasiainministeriö , inrikesministeriet ) rejected their asylum request and found no reason to grant them a residence permit .

On DATE the Hollola Police District proposed that the family be expelled . The family objected on DATE , arguing , inter alia , that although they had been citizens of the former GPE they had not become citizens of GPE . On DATE ORG ordered their expulsion to GPE , considering , inter alia , that they were citizens of the former GPE with no such ties to GPE as could prevent their expulsion . The ORG also prohibited the family from returning to GPE or any other NORP country during a period of DATE . The family appealed to ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) .

On DATE the present applicant was born . He was not registered as being entitled to NORP social security benefits . ORG ( sosiaali- ja terveyslautakunta , social- och hälsovårdsnämnden ) of GPE refused the applicant ’s mother ’s request for maternity allowance , noting that she was not a NORP citizen and had not been granted a residence permit in the country . No appeal was lodged against this refusal . The municipality donated to the applicant ’s mother a maternity package with various supplies .
In DATE the applicant ’s father obtained employment in PERSON . On DATE the applicant ’s parents were refused housing allowance , as they had no residence permits in GPE . They did not appeal .
On DATE ORG referred the matter back to the Ministry for renewed consideration , since the expulsion order had not concerned the present applicant .

On DATE the Hollola Police District proposed to that the applicant and his family be expelled . The applicant and his family objected and requested that the expulsion order would at least not be enforced until the applicant ’s possible entitlement to NORP citizenship had been examined .

In DATE the applicant requested to be granted NORP citizenship by application . On DATE ORG found no reason to grant him a residence permit . Instead the applicant and his family were ordered to be expelled to GPE , as they were all considered to be citizens of that ORG pursuant to its DATE LAW which had entered into force on DATE . In a memorandum of DATE the ORG recalled that the applicant ’s parents and his brother had arrived in GPE on a tourist visa . At the time when LAW had entered into force , the applicant ’s parents and his brother had not been permanently residing in GPE but in GPE . As the applicant ’s parents had thus become citizens of GPE , the Ministry concluded that the applicant had obtained NORP ( and thus not NORP ) citizenship by birth .
In DATE the applicant ’s father established his own company in PERSON .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s and his family ’s appeal against the new expulsion order .

In DATE the applicant and his family lodged a further request for residence permits , supported by , among others , the Chief of LOC . He stated that the applicant and his family had integrated well in GPE and that it would clearly be unreasonable to refuse them residence permits . In CARDINAL decisions of DATE the Ministry of the ORG nevertheless rejected the applicant ’s and his family ’s request . They then lodged an extraordinary appeal ( purkuhakemus , ansökan om återbrytande ) to ORG , requesting that the ORG ’s decision be quashed .

On DATE ORG objected to the applicant ’s and his family ’s request to ORG . ORG referred , inter alia , to its own inquiry according to which the applicant and his family had received NORP citizenship .

On DATE the Office for Alien Affairs ( ulkomaalaisvirasto , utlänningsverket ) requested the applicant ’s local Police District to inform the parents of the applicant of the costs of a negative decision on pursuing the application for citizenship .

On DATE ORG again considered that the applicant had already acquired NORP citizenship . Accordingly , he did not meet the conditions prescribed by section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW ( kansalaisuuslaki , medborgarskapslag CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) for granting him NORP citizenship by application .
On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s and his family ’s extraordinary appeal .
On DATE the Consul General of ORG in GPE certified that the applicant ’s parents or his brother were not citizens of GPE .

On DATE the applicant ’s request for NORP citizenship by application was withdrawn . Instead he requested that his NORP citizenship be confirmed by the President of the Republic , given that his parents had not acquired NORP citizenship whether by application , declaration or acceptance . It was therefore argued that he had received NORP citizenship by birth , pursuant to section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW .
On DATE the Consul General of the ORG certified that the applicant was not a citizen of GPE .

On DATE the Chief of ORG ordered the applicant and his family to leave GPE by DATE . The applicant and his family objected , referring , inter alia , to the pending request for a confirmation of the applicant ’s NORP citizenship and stating that they lacked the necessary travel documents .

On DATE the head of ORG of the Russian Embassy certified that pursuant to LAW of GPE none of the applicant ’s family members were NORP citizens . Their NORP passports were no longer in force and were to be handed over to the ORG . The family could request that new documents be issued to them by the NORP authorities “ because they were stateless ” . They would be unable to enter GPE without proper documents . In the letter it was also stated that the applicant ’s and his family ’s expulsion from GPE “ was not based on law ” .
On DATE the local ORG decided to afford the applicant municipal day care as from DATE . The applicant ’s brother enjoys the right to attend a public school in GPE .
On DATE the Chief of Police of PERSON stated that the enforcement of the expulsion order had been postponed indefinitely .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the head of ORG of ORG again confirmed that the applicant or his family were not citizens of GPE .

On DATE ORG considered , pursuant to section CARDINAL of LAW , that the applicant and his family were not entitled to sickness insurance benefits under the DATE LAW . ORG noted that the members of the applicant ’s family had arrived in GPE as refugees . Moreover , at the time of ORG decision the applicant and his family had no passports or work permits in GPE nor had they been entered in the NORP population register . The applicant and his family appealed to ORG ( sosiaalivakuutuslautakunta , socialförsäkringsnämnden ) on DATE , referring , in particular , to the fact that the applicant had been born in GPE .

On DATE the applicant ’s parents and brother were granted DATE residence permits in GPE . ORG now considered that their citizenship was unknown . It recalled that the attempts to enforce the expulsion order regarding the applicant and his family had failed . Most recently , the NORP authorities had stated , on DATE , that the applicant and his family would not be accepted back into that country .

The applicant ’s parents and his brother were granted aliens passports and temporary residence permits . The applicant has not lodged with the competent authorities an application for an alien ’s passport and a residence permit

On DATE ORG ( maistraatti , magistraten ) of PERSON stated that it could not yet deal with the applicant ’s request to be registered as resident in GPE and to be granted a personal identification number . The registration ORG referred to the pending citizenship proceedings and recalled that the applicant ’s registration would require proof of his NORP citizenship or residence permit .
On DATE the applicant ’s mother was granted a DATE child allowance for the applicant ’s brother exclusively .

On DATE ORG requested ORG to seek clarification from the NORP authorities as regards the applicant ’s and his family ’s citizenship . ORG now stated that under the terms of LAW , citizens of the former GPE who were permanently resident within GPE territory when the LAW entered into force were automatically granted NORP citizenship provided they did not refuse it within DATE from the entry into force of LAW . In the view of ORG , the applicant ’s parents had not presented evidence of such a refusal ( according to the applicant ’s family , their objection to becoming NORP citizens was addressed to the NORP authorities and lodged with ORG ) . The Ministry requested especially clarification , inter alia , as to why the applicant may not have received NORP citizenship at birth or , if he did so receive the citizenship , why and when he lost it later .

On DATE ORG granted the applicant ’s mother a housing allowance as from DATE and , on DATE , she was granted an employment allowance as from DATE . The applicant was not taken into account when the amounts of these allowances were fixed . On CARDINAL DATE the employment allowance and housing allowance were nevertheless increased , both children having been taken into account .

On DATE ORG of PERSON registered the applicant as resident in GPE and gave him a personal identification number . The applicant is registered in the official registry as born in GPE , which is a municipality in GPE , but stateless while the nationality of his mother is registered as unknown .

In a diplomatic note of CARDINAL DATE ORG of GPE conveyed the reply of ORG of the President of GPE to the NORP Ministry ’s question concerning the citizenship of the applicant and his family . The ORG stated as follows ( translation ) :

“ ORG of GPE expresses its respect for ORG and , referring to ORG notice no . ORG DATE dated DATE and to the notice no . ORG DATE dated DATE , it gives notice that ORG of the President of GPE has examined the citizenship of the PERSON family and declares as follows .

According to Decree no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL/CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL ( GPE Decree implementing GPE Decree amending and supplementing of GPE ) of ORG of GPE , citizens of the former GPE who , prior to DATE , were permanently resident abroad or had left the country temporarily for the purposes of work , studies , health care or private affairs , and who returned to the country after LAW of GPE entered into force , were , under LAW subsection CARDINAL of that Act , recognised as citizens of GPE . However , the PERSON family did not return to the country by this time and , as far as is known , have no intention of doing so .

According to GPE , citizenship is constituted by a continuous legal connection to the ORG , expressed in the unity of the mutual rights , obligations and liability between the person concerned and the ORG .

ORG , which examined the ORG case , which is comparable with the present case , defined nationality as a “ legal bond having as its basis a social fact of attachment , a genuine connection of existence , interests and sentiments , together with the existence of reciprocal rights and duties ” .
Given that the PERSON have resided in GPE for DATE they have , in the ORG ’s opinion , lost those ties to GPE and , more importantly , have not expressed their willingness to renew those ties .
The Commission concludes that the PERSON are , therefore , not citizens of GPE . ... ”
On DATE the applicant ’s mother was also granted a child allowance for the applicant .

In response to the applicant ’s and his family ’s appeal of DATE ORG ( tarkastuslautakunta , prövningsnämnden ) , onCARDINAL DATE , referred the matter back to ORG . According to the applicant and his family , ORG has considered it unnecessary to decide this matter separately and has referred to its decisions of CARDINAL and DATE .

In its opinion to the President of ORG , on DATE , considered that the applicant had not obtained NORP citizenship on his birth in GPE . ORG noted , inter alia , that on their arrival in GPE the applicant ’s parents and his brother had been citizens of GPE . They had not lost the citizenship of the successor ORG ( GPE ) by the time the applicant had been born . ORG decision discusses neither the NORP Decree of DATE to which ORG of the President of GPE referred in the applicant ’s and his family ’s case nor ORG certificates according to which the applicant and his family are not NORP citizens .
On DATE ORG , in a statement signed by an attaché , certified that pursuant to LAW the applicant was not and had not been a citizen of that ORG .
On DATE the President of the Republic declared , with reference to ORG opinion , that the applicant was not a NORP citizen .

The applicant has petitioned to ORG ( eduskunnan oikeusasiamies , riksdagens justitieombudsman ) concerning the excessive length of the proceedings pertaining to the applicant ’s request for a citizenship declaration . No decision has been made .
B. Relevant domestic law
Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) , of LAW ( as amended by Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) reads as follows ( translation ) :
“ A child receives NORP citizenship by birth :
... if [ it ] is born in GPE and does not at that time receive citizenship of any other country . ”

Under LAW ( sairausvakuutuslaki , sjukförsäkringslag CARDINAL ) , every “ resident ” in GPE is entitled to the benefits guaranteed therein . The interpretation of “ residence ” shall be decided by ORG ( kansaneläkelaitos , folkpensionsanstalten ) pursuant to the DATE Act on Social Security based on Residence ( laki asumiseen perustuvan sosiaaliturvalainsäädännön soveltamisesta , lag om tillämpning av lagstiftningen om bosättningsbaserad social trygghet DATE ) . Under this LAW a person shall be considered resident in GPE if his or her actual residence and home are in that country and he or she is permanently and principally staying there . An immigrant who intends to settle permanently can be considered resident as from his arrival , provided he or she is holding a residence permit valid for DATE ( should a permit be required ) . An asylum - seeker is not considered a resident if the decision on the asylum request or in the expulsion matter has not acquired legal force ( section CARDINAL ) . An appeal against ORG interpretation of “ residence ” lies to CARDINAL out of several authorities , depending on the requested benefit which underlies the dispute ( section CARDINAL ) .

Under LAW ( ulkomaalaislaki , utlänningslag CARDINAL ; later amended ) an aliens passport may be issued if the alien is unable to obtain a passport from his or her country of origin or if there is another exceptional reason for issuing such a document .
